Time utils

{% raw %} 
def to_hhmmss(x: int) -> str: 
    """Convert time from secs (int) to hh:mm:ss (str).

    Args:
        x (int): Time in seconds.

    Returns:
        str: Time in hh:mm:ss format.
    """
    
    return time.strftime("%H:%M:%S", time.gmtime(x))
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
to_hhmmss(5)

'00:00:05'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert to_hhmmss(100) == '00:01:40'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
to_hhmmss(10000)

'02:46:40'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def to_secs(x: str) -> int:
    """Convert time from hh:mm:ss (str) format to seconds (int).

    Args:
        x (str): Time in hh:mm:ss format.

    Returns:
        int: Time in seconds.
    """
    h, m, s = x.split(':')
    return int(h) * 3600 + int(m) * 60 + int(s)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
to_secs('02:46:40')

10000
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert to_secs('00:00:05') == 5
{% endraw %}

Video utils

Use this function to crop a video

{% raw %}

trim_video[source]

trim_video(video, start, end, outfile=None)

Crop a video in place from start to end. If you don't want to crop inplace, provide output filename. For youtube videos you can download_youtube_video before cropping it

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

check_resolution[source]

check_resolution(video:Union[str, Path])

Check the resolution of a video. Output is in the form of height, width

Args: video (Union[str, Path]): Path to video file.

Returns: Dict: height and width of the video

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
check_resolution('Anna.mp4')

{'height': 720, 'width': 1280}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert check_resolution('Anna.mp4') == {'height': 720, 'width': 1280}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

get_fps[source]

get_fps(video:Union[str, Path])

Get the fps of a video

Args: video (Union[str, Path]): Path of the video

Returns: float: fps of the video

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
get_fps('Anna.mp4')

29.97
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert get_fps('Anna.mp4') == 29.97
{% endraw %}

Audio utils

{% raw %}

change_audio_format[source]

change_audio_format(audio:Union[str, Path], outfile:Union[str, Path])

Change the format of audio file. Example, converting mp3 to wav. Works with all formats supported by ffmpeg.

Example: change_format('sample_audio.mp3', 'new_audio.wav')

Args: audio (Union[str, Path]): Path to the audio file you want to change the format of. Example: sample_audio.mp3 outfile (Union[str, Path]): Filename of the new file and it's format. Example: new_audio.wav

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
change_audio_format('demo_audio.wav', 'my_audio.mp3')
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
def trim_audio(audio: Union[str, Path], start_time: int, end_time: int, outfile: Union[str, Path] = 'trimmed_audio.mp3') -> None:
    """Trim an audio file. Works with all formats supported by ffmpeg.

    Examples: 
        trim_audio('sample_audio.mp3', 10, 20)
        trim_audio('sample_audio.mp3', 10, 20, 'my_audio.mp3')
        trim_audio('sample_audio.mp3', 10, 20, 'wav_output.wav')

    Args:
        audio (Union[str, Path]): Path of the audio file you want to trim.
        start_time (int): Start time in seconds.
        end_time (int): End time in seconds.
        outfile (Union[str, Path], optional): Name of the output file. This can also be 
                                              in a different format than the input file.
    """
    audio, outfile = Path(audio), Path(outfile)
    ext, o_ext = audio.suffix[1:], outfile.suffix[1:]
    f = AudioSegment.from_file(audio, ext)

    start_time = start_time * 1000
    end_time = end_time * 1000

    f = f[start_time:end_time]
    f.export(outfile, format = o_ext)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
trim_audio('my_audio.mp3', start_time=0, end_time=5)
{% endraw %}
